questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the correct commands from the right onto the blanks within the code on the left to implement a design that allow for dynamic spoke-to-spoke communication. Not all commands are used.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
C. reverse route injection

Reverse route injection (RRI) is a method that dynamically installs the network routes for remote tunnel endpoints. The RRI feature allows the router to automatically learn the routes for the remote networks and automatically install these routes into the routing table. This eliminates the need for the administrator to manually configure and maintain the routes for the remote networks. This feature is commonly used in VPN environments, where the router at the VPN endpoint needs to learn the routes for the remote networks behind the other VPN endpoint. The other options such as policy-based routing, CEF, and route filtering are not used to dynamically install the network routes for remote tunnel endpoints

questions.question_text: Which method dynamically installs the network routes for remote tunnel endpoints?

choices.A: Add a route on the remote peer for 209.165.201.0/27.
choices.B: Add a route on the local peer for 10.1.1.0/24.
choices.C: Add a permit for TCP traffic going to 10.1.1.0/24.
choices.D: Add a permit for TCP traffic going to 209.165.201.0/27.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If nothing is received from remote end (=decaps: 0) then it needs to be fixed on that end.
Most of the cases it is either routing or NAT.
tunnel working 1 way...remote peer need to reach local peer...A makes sense...this exam source is less relevent coz why admin is allowing wrong answers to be voted for???

comments.content: Hence the answer is A, since the cli shows successful encap but no decryption. which means the otherside vpn is hving problem sending traffic to this vpn

discussion.content: The question metioned that "Pings to the appropriate IP address are failing". So it's the routing that is the prob. (Cause ping is not tcp, it's icmp).

Selected Answer: C
C. I tested this in the lab. And you need to specify the service in the ACL.

questions.question_text: A network engineer must expand a company's Cisco AnyConnect solution. Currently, a Cisco ASA is set up in North America and another will be installed in Europe with a different IP address. Users should connect to the ASA that has the lowest Round Trip Time from their network location as measured by the AnyConnect client. Which solution must be implemented to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Optimal Gateway Selection (OGS). OGS is a feature that can be used in order to determine which gateway has the lowest Round Trip Time (RTT) and connect to that gateway. One can use the OGS feature in order to minimize latency for Internet traffic without user intervention. With OGS, Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client (AnyConnect) identifies and selects which secure gateway is best for connection or reconnection. OGS begins upon first connection or upon a reconnection at least four hours after the previous disconnection.

Selected Answer: D
Optimal Gateway Selection (OGS) is a feature that can be used for determining which gateway has the lowest RTT and connect to that gateway. Using the Optimal Gateway Selection (OGS) feature, administrators can minimize latency for Internet traffic without user intervention. With OGS, AnyConnect identifies and selects which secure gateway is best for connection or reconnection. OGS begins upon first connection or upon a reconnection at least four hours after the previous disconnection
'http-only' literally means HTTP only and nothing else. Hence, answer is D.

When the "http-only-cookie" command is enabled in clientless SSLVPN, it allows the use of the Script browser feature. This feature allows the SSLVPN to process websites that rely on JavaScript or AJAX, providing a seamless browsing experience for the user. On the other hand, the Java rewriter - Java Plug-ins feature is not directly related to the "http-only-cookie" command. It is used to rewrite Java applets so that they can be accessed and executed securely in a clientless SSLVPN environment.

Selected Answer: D
The following Clientless SSL VPN features will not work when the http-only-cookie command is
enabled:
• Java plug-ins
• Java rewriter
• Port forwarding
• File browser
• Sharepoint features that require desktop applications (for example, MS Office applications)
• AnyConnect Web launch
• Citrix Receiver, XenDesktop, and Xenon
• Other non-browser-based and browser plugin-based applications

questions.question_text: Which clientless SSLVPN supported feature works when the http-only-cookie command is enabled?
